metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5699 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
CRLF injection vulnerability in the HTTPConnection.putheader function in urllib2 and urllib in CPython (aka Python) before 2.7.10 and 3.x before 3.4.4 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTTP headers via CRLF sequences in a URL.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5699` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.10~rc1-1
libpython2.7 - 2.7.10~rc1-1
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.10~rc1-1
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.10~rc1-1
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.10~rc1-1
python2.7 - 2.7.10~rc1-1
python2.7-examples - 2.7.10~rc1-1
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.10~rc1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

idle-python3.5 - 3.5.0-1
libpython3.5 - 3.5.0-1
libpython3.5-minimal - 3.5.0-1
libpython3.5-stdlib - 3.5.0-1
libpython3.5-testsuite - 3.5.0-1
python3.5 - 3.5.0-1
python3.5-examples - 3.5.0-1
python3.5-minimal - 3.5.0-1
python3.5-venv - 3.5.0-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.10~rc1-1').
python3.5 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.5.0-1').
